abstracts.cdata!:
This strategy document broadly outlines
            the context of socioeconomic, and development status of
            tribal groups in the project area, and presents a plan to
            address these within the framework of the project. It
            presents an overview of tribal communities in the area, the
            legal and policy framework regarding tribal issues in
            Chhattisgarh, and the major problems, and concerns tribal
            people face in securing access to revenue land, and to
            forests. Fundamental strategies stipulate: fair
            participation, and representation at all levels of the
            project, with a view to influence its decisions, and
            outcomes for the tribal constituents; ensured protection of
            social, economic, and cultural interest of tribal
            communities in project interventions, among both the tribal,
            and the non-tribal groups; overcome structural constraints
            to poverty, and deprivation among tribal people, through
            direct socioeconomic interventions, as well as induced
            actions under other available public resources, and legal
            provisions of the Government; optimize community
            productivity, and that of privately held land, forest, and
            livestock resources among tribal people, with a view to
            primarily ensure food security, and generate sustainable
            surplus; enhance options for labor, and for improved returns
            from labor, as a growing basis for livelihood activity for
            largest number of tribal families in the region; and,
            rigorous capacity building of tribal people at the
            village-level organizations, and at its leadership level, to
            be able to plan, prioritize, and place appropriate demands
            on project services, and resources.
